alert.note: Alert for Perry; Stone (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 29 at 12:06PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Perry and western Stone Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1205 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles northwest of McHenry, or 9 miles southwest of Wiggins, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wiggins and Perkinston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
